lotr.menu.title: 'Tis the Ring-Lord's Mod: that bringeth forth Middle-Earth to Minecraft - Renewed
lotr.menu.subtitle: A work underway now you hold; yet stay, and see this timeless story told.
item.lotr.fish_and_chips.subtitle: Just like my old Gaffer makes it!
item.lotr.coast_southron_warrior_spawn_e: Adder Stone o' Coast Southron Warrior
item.lotr.blue_mountains_dwarf_spawn_egg: Adder Stone o' Blue Mountains Dwarf
item.lotr.blue_mountains_warrior_spawn_e: Adder Stone o' Blue Mountains Warrior
gui.lotr.worldTypeHelp.title: Welcome to §oThe Lord of the Rings§r mod! If this is your first time playing, here's how to get to Middle-earth...
gui.lotr.worldTypeHelp.normal: Select '%s' world type to start in the ordinary §oMinecraft§r world, where you can create a portal to Middle-earth by throwing a Gold Ring into fire.
gui.lotr.worldTypeHelp.me: Or, select '%s' world type to spawn directly into Middle-earth.
generator.lotr.me_classic.info: Spawn directly into Middle-earth, with random biome generation
gui.lotr.map.title: %s Map
gui.lotr.map.locked.enemy: This waypoint is not at the disposal of this region's foes
gui.lotr.map.locked.region: Attain this waypoint by travelling to its region
gui.lotr.map.fastTravel.prompt: Press '%s' to travel much faster to thine chosen waypoint
gui.lotr.map.fastTravel.moreTime: Thou can'st fast travel to thine chosen waypoint in: %s
gui.lotr.map.fastTravel.waitTime: (Waypoint wait time: %s. Decreases after each journey here)
gui.lotr.map.areaOfInfluence.title: Displaying the areas that %s doth influence
gui.lotr.map.areaOfInfluence.disabled: Areas of influence hath been verily disabled in this world!
gui.lotr.map.areaOfInfluence.reduced: Alignment area of a reduced state
gui.lotr.factions.title: %s Factions
gui.lotr.factions.rankGender.masc: Have a preference of male ranks
gui.lotr.factions.rankGender.fem: Have a preference of feminine ranks
gui.lotr.factions.viewMap: View areas of influence on the map
gui.lotr.factions.pledge.desc.1: If thou to the service of %s pledgeth, thou shalt be admitted to their friendship and granted worthy beneficials, moreover to conquest their foes.
gui.lotr.factions.pledge.desc.2: If thine choice is to make this pledge, your desertion may at any time be figur'd, alas! a penalty is always exacted.
gui.lotr.factions.pledge.breakCooldown: %1$s doth not accept the pledge of traitors; the world hath not so easily forgotten thine pledge to %2$s.
gui.lotr.factions.pledge.enemies: Thou can'st not pledge service to %s whilst maintaining good services with their mortal foes. (%s)
gui.lotr.factions.unpledge.desc.1: Be'est thou ever so sure of thine choice to break the pledge to %s?
gui.lotr.factions.unpledge.desc.2: A penalty wilt be exacted, withal thine pledge to another will not be accepted for some time.
gui.lotr.factions.pledgeLocked: Thou shalt not stand with %1$s alignment whilst maintaining a pledge to %2$s
gui.lotr.factions.civilianKills.yes: This faction merrily doth encourage war crimes (the slaying of innocent enemy citizens)
gui.lotr.factions.civilianKills.no: This faction verily denounces war crimes (the slaying of innocent enemy citizens)
gui.lotr.message.notDisplayedAgain: This message will not be displayed again
gui.lotr.message.friendly_fire:
Shalt thine offense be rank? having the inclination thou attempt'st to slay an friendly NPC!

Thou hath Friendly Fire disabled, preventing thee from thine own bedfellows slaying. To enable Friendly Fire, open the Middle-earth menu and navigate to Options.
gui.lotr.message.align_drain:
When thou doth see'th here icon:



thou standeth to lose alignment with one or more factions due to alignment (+) with a Mortal Foe of theirs.
Keep a close and eyeful look on your alignments!
gui.lotr.cwp.create.title: Create Custom Waypoint
gui.lotr.cwp.create.name: Name:
gui.lotr.cwp.create.public.help.1: If you publish your custom waypoint, other players will be able to activate it and use it for themselves.
gui.lotr.cwp.update.title: Renew Custom Waypoint
gui.lotr.cwp.update.name: Rename:
gui.lotr.cwp.destroy.title: Destroy Custom Waypoint
gui.lotr.cwp.destroy.warning.1: Be'est thou ever so sure thou yearns to destroy custom waypoint '%s'?
gui.lotr.cwp.destroy.warning.3: Thou shalt not have a chance to travel here again, and thine wait time to travel will be lost.
gui.lotr.cwp.destroy.warning.adopted: %d players who hath adopted this waypoint shall also lose it!
gui.lotr.cwp.adopt.title: Adopt Custom Waypoint
gui.lotr.cwp.adopt.help.1: By adoption of this waypoint, you the player hereby shall now be able to travel to it as if it were your own.
gui.lotr.cwp.adopt.help.2: Nary but the owner of this waypoint shall have cause to destroy or remedy it!
gui.lotr.cwp.adopted.title: Adopted Custom Waypoint
gui.lotr.cwp.forsake.title: Forsake Custom Waypoint
gui.lotr.cwp.forsake.warning.1: Be'est thou ever so sure thou yearns to forsake custom waypoint '%s'?
gui.lotr.cwp.forsake.warning.2: Thou shalt not have a chance to travel here again, and thine wait time to travel will be lost.
waypoint.lotr.himling.lore: The pike of the hill of Himring, that which hath most drowned following the War of Wrath.
waypoint.lotr.tol_fuin.lore: The highlands of the Forest under Nightshade, which hath the drowning of Beleriand survived.
waypoint.lotr.tol_morwen.lore: A lone hill spared when Beleriand did drown, upon which lay the grave of Morwen mother of Túrin Turambar.
waypoint.lotr.hobbiton.lore: A town of Hobbits in the centre of the Shire, overpeered by the Hill of Bag End.
waypoint.lotr.brandywine_bridge.lore: A bridge across the River Brandywine which follows out of the Shire.
waypoint.lotr.sarn_ford.lore: A ford on the southern edge of the Shire. Though the Shire-folk know not, it is carefully guarded.
waypoint.lotr.longbottom.lore: A town in the Southfarthing of the Shire, renowned for its Longbottom Leaf.
waypoint.lotr.michel_delving.lore: The chief town of the Shire, established in the White Downs, where the Mayor of Michel Delving doth reside.
waypoint.lotr.willowbottom.lore: A small village near the Woody End.
waypoint.lotr.bucklebury.lore: The chief village of Buckland, home of the Master of Buckland.
waypoint.lotr.whitfurrows.lore: A small town upon the East Road.
waypoint.lotr.frogmorton.lore: A village upon the East Road by the Frog-marshes.
waypoint.lotr.oatbarton.lore: A village in the Northfarthing of the Shire.
waypoint.lotr.scary.lore: A small Hobbit village amongst caves and stony hills.
waypoint.lotr.needlehole.lore: A town in the Westfarthing of the Shire.
waypoint.lotr.little_delving.lore: A smaller Hobbit town upon the White Downs.
waypoint.lotr.waymeet.lore: A town upon the crossings of significant Shire-roads.
waypoint.lotr.tuckborough.lore: An old town within the Green Hill Country. Home of the family Took, the Thains of the Shire.
waypoint.lotr.nobottle.lore: A town in the Westfarthing of the Shire.
waypoint.lotr.tighfield.lore: A village beknownst for its rope-makers.
waypoint.lotr.brockenborings.lore: A warren of tunnels within the rocky hills round Scary.
waypoint.lotr.deephallow.lore: A village upon the banks of the River Brandywine.
waypoint.lotr.stock.lore: A town by the Stock-brook found, upon the banks of the Brandywine.
waypoint.lotr.bywater.lore: A village by the Pool upon the Water, where sits the well known Green Dragon Inn.
waypoint.lotr.overhill.lore: A small village north of Hobbiton and the Hill.
waypoint.lotr.haysend.lore: A village in the south of Buckland where the Hedge did endeth.
waypoint.lotr.hay_gate.lore: The guarded North Gate in the Hedge of Buckland.
waypoint.lotr.greenholm.lore: A small town upon the Far Downs at the western border of the Shire.
waypoint.lotr.withywindle_valley.lore: An uncanny and haunted valley where the Withywindle doth run through the Old Forest.
waypoint.lotr.forlond.lore: A harbor-city of the Elves upon the northern shores of the Gulf of Lune.
waypoint.lotr.harlond.lore: A harbor-city upon the southern shores of the Gulf Lune, that Elves did build.
waypoint.lotr.north_mithlond.lore: A harbor-city upon the northern shores of the Gulf Lune, that Elves did build.
waypoint.lotr.south_mithlond.lore: The southern half of Mithlond, where dwells Círdan the Shipwright with his people.
waypoint.lotr.elostirion.lore: Tallest of the White Towers of Elendil, by Gil-Galad built, rumoured to house one Seeing-stone of Arnor.
waypoint.lotr.amon_ereb.lore: An hill of Elder Days in Lindon, which long ago a lookout-post of great importance did house.
waypoint.lotr.belegost.lore: An ancient Dwarven city of the Mountains Blue, which was in the Elder Days. It was after the War of Wrath destroyed, but later resettled, in part.
waypoint.lotr.nogrod.lore: An ancient Dwarven city of the Mountains Blue, which was in the Elder days. It was after the War of Wrath destroyed, but later resettled, in part.
waypoint.lotr.mount_rerir.lore: A large mountain long ago during the War of Wrath ruined. In Elder Days a fortress of Caranthir son of Fëanor did stand upon its slopes.
waypoint.lotr.mount_dolmed.lore: Said to be the awakening-place of two Fathers of the Dwarves, cloven in the War of Wrath and in size diminished.
waypoint.lotr.thorins_halls.lore: Once ruled by Thorin Oakenshield, those Folk of Durin inhabit these settlements most.
waypoint.lotr.arveduis_mines.lore: Abandoned mines in the Blue Mountains. Here the last King of Arnor and his company once hid to escape the threat of Angmar.
waypoint.lotr.thrains_halls.lore: A Dwarven settlement, founded by Thráin and the exiles of the Lonely Mountain. Many old mines they still use today.
waypoint.lotr.north_downs.lore: A range of hills in northern Eriador, at which south end lies the ancient city Norbury.
waypoint.lotr.south_downs.lore: A range of hills in Eriador.
waypoint.lotr.tharbad.lore: An old ford-town in Eriador, deserted following the Great Plague.
waypoint.lotr.fornost.lore: Kings' Norbury, the ruined capital of Arnor
waypoint.lotr.annuminas.lore: The old capital of Arnor, the North-kingdom, before it was abandoned in favour of Kings' Norbury.
waypoint.lotr.greenway_crossroads.lore: The crossing of the great East-West and North-South roads.
waypoint.lotr.bree.lore: The chief town of the Bree-land. Its cheerful Hobbits and Men bring it fame.
waypoint.lotr.staddle.lore: A town of Hobbits in the Bree-land.
waypoint.lotr.combe.lore: A village of Men on the road to the Chetwood.
waypoint.lotr.archet.lore: A town of the Bree-folk on the edge of the Chetwood with a lively logging trade.
waypoint.lotr.forsaken_inn.lore: A day's ride east of Bree, an inn most lonely, the last settlement of Men before the wild lands.
waypoint.lotr.weathertop.lore: The ruined watchtower of Amon Sûl. In olden days it one of the great Seeing Stones of Arnor did house.
waypoint.lotr.last_bridge.lore: The last bridge on the Great East Road before the Misty Mountains.
waypoint.lotr.old_elven_way.lore: An old road once travelled by Elves of Hollin.
waypoint.lotr.rivendell.lore: The hidden valley of Imladris, where Lord Elrond with his people dwells in the Last Homely House East of the Sea.
waypoint.lotr.ford_of_bruinen.lore: A shallow ford that crosses the Loudwater into the realm of Rivendell.
waypoint.lotr.trolls_cave.lore: The long-abandoned lair of three infamous Trolls who met their end many years ago.
waypoint.lotr.carn_dum.lore: The capital of the old Kingdom of Angmar.
waypoint.lotr.west_gate.lore: The western gate of Khazad-dûm, now called Moria: of old the great delvings and mansions of the Dwarves of Durin's Folk and a wonder of the Northern world.
waypoint.lotr.ost_in_edhil.lore: The ruined city of the Elves of Hollin.
waypoint.lotr.duneard.lore: A shepherders and hunters village in the northern reaches of Dunland.
waypoint.lotr.firwold.lore: A town of middling size in the highs of Dunland, where many traders and travellers stop while journeying through the region.
waypoint.lotr.fords_of_isen.lore: These shallow fords across the River Isen into Rohan are often the site of skirmishes between the Rohirrim and the Orcs.
waypoint.lotr.dwarrowvale.lore: A Dunlending village grown up around the site of an old hamlet, which, it is said, once hosted Thráin and Thorin Oakenshield during their long wanderings in the wild.
waypoint.lotr.wulfburg.lore: Once the fortress of Freca's son, the self-styled 'King' Wulf, who seized Meduseld for Dunland during the reign of Helm Hammerhand.
waypoint.lotr.lond_daer.lore: The ancient ruins of the first haven of the men of Westernesse in Middle-earth.
waypoint.lotr.old_south_road.lore: With the North-kingdom long fallen and the power of the South-kingdom waning, these stretches of the old Royal Road have long since into ruin fallen.
waypoint.lotr.mouths_of_isen.lore: Here the River Isen flows into the Sea after its long course through sparsely-inhabited middlelands.
waypoint.lotr.isengard.lore: A great fortified ring of stone within a vale of the Misty Mountains, wherein stands the tower of Orthanc, stronghold of Saruman.
waypoint.lotr.cape_of_forochel.lore: CHANGE The perilous floes of the Icebay, where only the Snowmen of Northis dare wander. >>> The perilous floes of the Icebay, where only the Snow-men of Forochel dare wander.
waypoint.lotr.south_forochel.lore: One of few permanent settlements of the Lossoth among the frozen wastes.
waypoint.lotr.withered_heath.lore: A scorched valley in the Grey Mountains where, it is said, lurk the last of the Fire-drakes.
waypoint.lotr.mount_gundabad.lore: The mountain beneath which Durin the Deathless awoke in the Elder Days, and a sacred site of the Dwarves before being overrun by Orcs.
waypoint.lotr.mount_gram.lore: A mountain inhabited by Orcs who often trouble the lands of Eriador.
waypoint.lotr.high_pass.lore: A long and perilous mountain pass from Eriador into Wilderland.
waypoint.lotr.mount_caradhras.lore: Caradhras, one of three peaks above the delvings of Dwarrowdelf. The mountain is called Redhorn the Cruel and is said to have a will of its own.
waypoint.lotr.mount_celebdil.lore: Celebdil, one of the peaks above Dwarrowdelf. Upon its summit stands the fabled Durin's Tower.
waypoint.lotr.mount_fanuidhol.lore: Fanuidhol, one of three peaks above the realm of Dwarrowdelf.
waypoint.lotr.mount_methedras.lore: Methedras, southermost of the Misty Mountains, whence flow the Rivers Isen and Entwash.
waypoint.lotr.goblin_town.lore: A warren of weaving tunnels and caverns beneath the High Pass, where Orcs scutter and scrape in the dark.
waypoint.lotr.eagles_eyrie.lore: A great shelf of rock on the eastern side of the Misty Mountains that can be reached only by flight. The Eagles of Manwë reside here.
waypoint.lotr.dains_halls.lore: A colony of Durin's Folk in the Grey Mountains, abandoned after Dáin was slain by a Cold-drake.
waypoint.lotr.scathas_lair.lore: Once the lair of Scatha, a great Long-worm, before he was slain by Fram of the Éothéod.
waypoint.lotr.carrock.lore: A towering pillar of rock in the midst of the Great River. It was once said that, on clear nights, a great bear could be seen climbing the rock to gaze upon the Moon.
waypoint.lotr.old_ford.lore: The crossing of the Old Forest Road upon the Great River of Wilderland. A bridge once stood here, but has long since crumbled.
waypoint.lotr.dimrill_dale.lore: Azanulbizar, below the East Gate of Dwarrowdelf: the valley of the Mirrormere, wherein it is said Durin the Deathless first saw his crown among the stars.
waypoint.lotr.field_of_celebrant.lore: The site of the Gondor-Éothéod victory over the Balchoth, which led to the historic Oath of Cirion and Eorl.
waypoint.lotr.rauros.lore: The shores of Green Sward by the great falls of Rush-rain.
waypoint.lotr.beorns_hall.lore: A rustic homestead inhabited by skin-changers and men of the Vales, said to be unfriendly to outsiders.
waypoint.lotr.forest_gate.lore: Once the entrance to the Wood-elven realm in Greenwood the Great, the gate of Mirkwood is now defiled by servants of the Enemy.
waypoint.lotr.framsburg.lore: The ruined city of the Éothéod, Northmen ancestors of the Rohirrim.
waypoint.lotr.thranduils_halls.lore: The underground halls of Thranduil the Elvenking. It is said that they recall the glory of the Thousand Caves in days of old.
waypoint.lotr.dol_guldur.lore: Dol Guldur: fortress-lair of the Necromancer before he fled eastwards, now inhabited by Khamûl the Easterling and his fell servants.
waypoint.lotr.rhosgobel.lore: The dwelling-place of Radagast the Brown, home to many birds and beasts, and a safe haven among the corruption of Mirkwood.
waypoint.lotr.enchanted_river.lore: Here the Elf-path crosses over a gloomy black river. It is advised to avoid these waters, for whoever touches them shall not awake...
waypoint.lotr.river_gate.lore: An outpost of the Wood-elves at the end of the Old Forest Road, where it meets the River Running.
waypoint.lotr.east_bight.lore: Once a thriving region of the Greenwood, the axes of Men have reduced it to a field of stumps and broken trees.
waypoint.lotr.old_rhovanion.lore: Long ago, these lands were held by a great Mannish kingdom of Rhovanion, but now its ruins are all that remain.
waypoint.lotr.dorwinion_crossroads.lore: A crossing in the great roads of Dale and Dorwinion.
waypoint.lotr.erebor.lore: Herein lies the Kingdom under the Mountain, a realm of Durin's Folk.
waypoint.lotr.dale.lore: The prosperous city of the Kingdom of Dale at the foot of the Lonely Mountain. It was destroyed by Smaug the Terrible in days of old, but rebuilt under King Bard.
waypoint.lotr.long_lake.lore: Upon the Long Lake stands Lake-town, a Northman settlement bustling with trade. Great wealth flows through this town out of Dale and onward to southern lands.
waypoint.lotr.running_ford.lore: A shallow ford on the River Running where the road runs south to old Rhovanion.
waypoint.lotr.redwater_ford.lore: A ford on the Redwater at the eastern border of the Kingdom of Dale, upon the ancient East-West Road laid by the Dwarves.
waypoint.lotr.great_dalish_crossroads.lo: At the meeting of several important Dalish roads, the lands around this crossing are home to many guilds and thriving markets.
waypoint.lotr.bardhaven.lore: The southern port of the Kingdom of Dale, and an important point on the trade routes of the Land of Youth.
waypoint.lotr.west_peak.lore: The nearer of two large peaks in the Iron Hills. Beneath are the halls of Dáin Ironfoot.
waypoint.lotr.east_peak.lore: A large mountain at the far eastern end of the Iron Hills.
waypoint.lotr.caras_galadhon.lore: The city of the Galadhrim in Lothlórien, and the heart of Elvendom on earth.
waypoint.lotr.cerin_amroth.lore: A great green hill in the midst of Lothlórien from where it is said one may see as far as southern Mirkwood.
waypoint.lotr.house_of_nimrodel: House of the Lady of the White Cave
waypoint.lotr.house_of_nimrodel.lore: The former home of an Elf-maiden, Nimrodel, who disappeared grieving after her beloved Amroth was drowned in the Sundering Seas.
waypoint.lotr.derndingle.lore: A meeting-place for the Ents of Entwood, set within a hidden clearing.
waypoint.lotr.wellinghall.lore: One of Treebeard's Ent-houses nestled among the spurs of the Last Peak.
waypoint.lotr.treebeards_hill.lore: A rocky shelf, standing above the trees of the Entwood, where one can contemplate the sunlight on the leaves and the wind among their branches.
waypoint.lotr.woldhall.lore: A small town in the sparsely inhabited uplands of Rohan.
waypoint.lotr.edoras.lore: The chief city of the Riddermark, built upon a hill crowned with the Golden Hall of Meduseld.
waypoint.lotr.helms_deep.lore: The great Rohirric fortress of the Hornburg, which stands in a wide vale beneath the Thrihyrne. Men say that its Deeping Wall has never to this day been breached.
waypoint.lotr.deeping_coomb.lore: The vale at the foot of Helm's Deep.
waypoint.lotr.mering_stream.lore: This stream marks the border between Rohan and Gondor. It runs through Firienholt, the Whispering Wood.
waypoint.lotr.entwade.lore: A ford across the river Entwash, bridging the Eastemnet and the Westemnet.
waypoint.lotr.aldburg.lore: The first capital of Rohan, Aldburg is the oldest town in the Riddermark and the seat of the Third Marshal of the Rohirrim.
waypoint.lotr.grimslade.lore: The home of Grimbold, a Marshal of the Riddermark.
waypoint.lotr.corsairs_landing.lore: In the days of Helm Hammerhand, a fleet of Southrons landed here and fought alongside the Dunlendings to defeat the Men of Rohan.
waypoint.lotr.frecas_hold.lore: The old fort raised by the heedless Lord Freca, who ruled the lands around the River Adorn, and was said to be part-Dunlending.
waypoint.lotr.dunharrow.lore: A refuge of the Rohirrim beneath the Dwimorberg, the Haunted Mountain. It is said that none living may pass the Paths of the Dead.
waypoint.lotr.tarlangs_neck.lore: Men say that a giant fell here and broke his neck, forming the mountain pass between the Blackroot Vale and Lamedon.
waypoint.lotr.ras_morthil.lore: The last peak at the headland of the western White Mountains. The Men of Anfalas say that wild Púkel-men still linger in these lands.
waypoint.lotr.minas_tirith.lore: The great Minas Tirith, capital city of the kingdom of Gondor, built of seven levels of pure white stone with the bright Tower of Ecthelion at its summit.
waypoint.lotr.cair_andros.lore: A fortified island in the Anduin, named for the white foam of the waters that run beside it.
waypoint.lotr.halifirien.lore: Halifirien, westernmost of the beacon-hills of Gondor. Elendil was once entombed here, and Cirion and Eorl swore their Oath upon its slopes.
waypoint.lotr.calenhad.lore: The sixth beacon-hill, lit only in times of urgency.
waypoint.lotr.min_rimmon.lore: The fifth beacon-hill and one of the oldest, established before the founding of Rohan.
waypoint.lotr.erelas.lore: The fourth beacon-hill of Gondor. Bare and treeless, it is easily sighted from the surrounding lands.
waypoint.lotr.nardol.lore: The third beacon-hill, built on a stretch of the White Mountains. On a clear night its fire is said to be seen all the way from the Halifirien.
waypoint.lotr.eilenach.lore: The second beacon-hill from Minas Tirith, and the highest point of the Drúadan Forest.
waypoint.lotr.amon_din.lore: The Silent Hill is the closest beacon to Minas Tirith. Overlooking northern Ithilien, it serves as a fortified outpost for the White City.
waypoint.lotr.west_osgiliath.lore: The crumbling western half of Gondor’s former capital city. Garrisons are housed here to hold the Anduin under Gondorian control.
waypoint.lotr.east_osgiliath.lore: The ruined eastern half of Gondor’s former capital city, now often the site of clashes between Gondorians and Orcs.
waypoint.lotr.emyn_arnen.lore: In better days these hills were the residence of some noble and wealthy Gondorian families, including the House of the Stewards.
waypoint.lotr.henneth_annun.lore: The Forbidden Pool of Ithilien, where the Window-curtain waterfall masks a secret refuge.
waypoint.lotr.crossroads_of_the_fallen_k: These neglected crossroads once housed a majestic statue of a King, which, though now ruined, still wears a coronal of silver and gold.
waypoint.lotr.crossings_of_poros.lore: The crossing into Harondor over the River Poros. Nearby stands a great mound, wherein rest the twin sons of King Folcwine of Rohan.
waypoint.lotr.pelargir.lore: The great royal havens of the Ship-kings: the chief harbour of Gondor.
waypoint.lotr.linhir.lore: A river-town in southern Gondor upon the road from Pelargir to Ethring.
waypoint.lotr.ethir_anduin.lore: The Mouths of Anduin, home to poor fisher-folk of Gondor.
waypoint.lotr.imloth_melui.lore: The sweet Valley of Roses within Lossarnach.
waypoint.lotr.crossings_of_erui.lore: The fords of the River Erui in Lossarnach. Many Gondorians once perished here in the Kin-strife.
waypoint.lotr.calembel.lore: A town in Lamedon near the fords of the River Ciril, with few inhabitants.
waypoint.lotr.ethring.lore: A long bridge in the Ringló Vale on the road from Pelargir to Erech.
waypoint.lotr.erech.lore: A great steep hill, believed to be haunted, and known for the mysterious black stone which stands upon the summit.
waypoint.lotr.hirluins_halls.lore: The seat of Hirluin the Fair, lord of the beautiful Green Hills of Gondor.
waypoint.lotr.dol_amroth.lore: A mighty castle and city upon the shores of Belfalas, ruled by the Prince of Dol Amroth, a subject of Gondor.
waypoint.lotr.edhellond.lore: An ancient harbour of the Sindar in southern Gondor. The Elves who once dwelt at these havens sailed West long ago.
waypoint.lotr.tarnost.lore: A city in Gondor built in ancient days by Elves who have long since sailed West.
waypoint.lotr.tolfalas.lore: A bleak abandoned isle in the Bay of Belfalas.
waypoint.lotr.amon_hen.lore: Amon Hen, an ancient seat of Gondorian power.
waypoint.lotr.amon_lhaw.lore: Amon Lhaw, an ancient seat of Gondorian power.
waypoint.lotr.argonath.lore: Argonath: two mighty statues of Isildur and Anárion beside the Anduin, which guard what was once the northern border of Gondor.
waypoint.lotr.north_undeep.lore: The northern of two westward bends in the Great River Anduin. The shallow fords of the Undeeps were often used by armies as a crossing-point.
waypoint.lotr.south_undeep.lore: The southern of two westward bends in the Great River Anduin. The shallow fords of the Undeeps were often used by armies as a crossing-point.
waypoint.lotr.black_gate.lore: The great gates of Mordor, wrought of twisted steel and dark stone. None pass unless the Eye of the Dark Tower wills it.
waypoint.lotr.mount_doom.lore: Orodruin, the great Fire-mountain in the heart of Mordor, wherein Sauron forged the One Ring long ago.
waypoint.lotr.barad_dur.lore: Barad-dûr: fortress of Sauron, Lord of the Earth, and the seat from which all the evil hosts of Mordor are bent to his will.
waypoint.lotr.minas_morgul.lore: Once the Tower of the Moon, the fair Tower of the Moon; now a dark and sickly place ruled by the Lord of the Nazgûl.
waypoint.lotr.durthang.lore: A powerful Orcish stronghold built upon the slopes of Ephel Dúath.
waypoint.lotr.carach_angren.lore: The Iron Teeth, a guarded mountain pass between Udûn and the plateau of Gorgoroth.
waypoint.lotr.cirith_ungol.lore: The dark and twisted Spider's Cleft within the mountains of Mordor, watched over by an evil guard-tower.
waypoint.lotr.mornost.lore: A watch-post upon the shadowy spurs of the Ephel Dúath.
waypoint.lotr.narroth.lore: Narroth, a watchtower above the pass into the plateau of Gorgoroth.
waypoint.lotr.amon_angren.lore: A dark hill in Mordor, upon which stands a fortress of the Nazgûl.
waypoint.lotr.seregost.lore: A fortress in the Mountains of Mordor. The armies of the Easterlings pass through here on the road to Barad-dûr.
waypoint.lotr.vale_of_the_fell_beasts.lo: A dark valley behind the walls of Mordor infested with fell beasts and evil creatures.
waypoint.lotr.eastern_guard.lore: A fortress that keeps watch over the road into Mordor out of Rhûn.
waypoint.lotr.fornurnen.lore: The dreary northern shores of the Sea of Núrnen.
waypoint.lotr.harnurnen.lore: The bleak southern shores of the Sea of Núrnen.
waypoint.lotr.dunurnen.lore: The sad western shores of the Sea of Núrnen.
waypoint.lotr.rhunurnen.lore: The dim eastern shores of the Sea of Núrnen.
waypoint.lotr.thorband.lore: A terrible prison-fortress of Mordor upon the shores of Núrnen.
waypoint.lotr.valley_of_spiders.lore: A grim and shadowy corner of Mordor, infested with the spawn of Ungoliant.
waypoint.lotr.mirulond.lore: The Wine-havens upon the Celduin, where the Avarin Elves of Dorwinion receive shipments from their kin in the Woodland Realm.
waypoint.lotr.vintner_court.lore: The shining centre of all trade, learning, and culture within the Mannish realm of Dorwinion.
waypoint.lotr.golden_ford.lore: A crossing out of Dorwinion into the lands of Rhúdel.
waypoint.lotr.amon_gwin.lore: A high peak in the hills of Dorwinion.
waypoint.lotr.crossings_of_harnen.lore: This river marks the border of the contested land of Harondor. From here, the road runs on southwards into the vast Sunlands of the Haradwaith.
waypoint.lotr.belkadar.lore: Where the mighty Harnen river meets the Bay of Belover stands the greatest stronghold of the Harnedhrim, a rallying-point against their foes to the North.
waypoint.lotr.an_batina.lore: A Southron town beyond the crossings of the Harnen, built upon the meeting of many roads.
waypoint.lotr.ugri_zadin.lore: A small but fortified town of Harnennor. The Haradrim speak of a time when Lord Sauron sent a rain of ash upon their lands, to deliver them from Gondorian invaders.
waypoint.lotr.crossings_of_lithnen.lore: The fords over the river Sandwater and on to eastern lands. Often in ages past were these waters stained red by the conquering swords of Gondor.
waypoint.lotr.ninzadin.lore: A settlement of the Southrons by the river Harnen. Here stands a gruesome tower decorated with the skulls of fallen Northerlings.
waypoint.lotr.gath_azrazain.lore: An ancient Westernesse fortress built to watch over the coastlands. It fell long ago into the hands of the Haradrim.
waypoint.lotr.gate_of_fuinur.lore: Built long ago by the mighty Black Númenórean lord Fuinur, these fortified gates protect the realm of Umbar from foes to the north.
waypoint.lotr.ain_an_ahar.lore: The Eye of Harad, a fabled city of the South counted as a wonder even among the Haradrim themselves.
waypoint.lotr.ajtiaz_an_ahar.lore: A great Southron city, from whence trade commences from o’er all the far lands of Harad and Rhûn, and whose famed markets do bustle within.
waypoint.lotr.gardens_of_beruthiel.lore: The infamous Queen Berúthiel having many lovers, one Southron warlord who was most jealous built the ancient wonder known as the beautiful hanging gardens of Harad.
waypoint.lotr.umbar.lore: The proud city of the Black Westernessen and the Corsairs, nearest of the great realms of Harad, having a long and brutal history of strife against Gondor.
waypoint.lotr.gate_of_umbar.lore: The low pass into the fief-lands of Umbar.
waypoint.lotr.gate_of_herumor.lore: Long ago Herumor himself did order construction of this great fortress, which hath ne’er fallen o’er the guarding of the Bay of Umbar.
waypoint.lotr.ijdi_ilel.lore: Wherewith a place desert wanderers tradeth and speak tales in the shade of the Sandwater Hills; here lies an encampment of the Southron nomads.

chat.lotr.respawn.farFromBed: Thou did'st die far from your bed, so thou hath respawn'd near whereabout thine death
chat.lotr.respawn.farFromWorldSpawn: Thou did'st die far from the world spawn, so thou hath respawn'd near whereabout thine death
chat.lotr.ft.disabled.gamerule: Fast travel is disabled on this server
chat.lotr.ft.disabled.worldtype: Fast travel is disabled on this world type
chat.lotr.ft.moreTime: Thou can'st not yet fast travel to %s
chat.lotr.ft.underAttack: Thou can'st not fast travel whilst under attack
chat.lotr.ft.motion: Fast travel hath stopped. Don't move!
chat.lotr.ft.offlineTick: Since thou hath last been online (%s ago), thine fast travel clock hath ticked forwards by %s
chat.lotr.pledge.break.intentional: Thou hath broken thine pledge to %s!
chat.lotr.pledge.break.unintentional: %s hath lost faith in your existence, and hath cancelled thine pledge!
chat.lotr.pledge.killWarn: Bewary sirs and madames! Thine actions thou commit'est risk breaking thine pledge to %s!
chat.lotr.pledge.breakCooldown: Time has passed, and the world has forgotten your broken pledge to %s

chat.lotr.cwp.structure.invalid.crown: Waypoint structure's crown, if present, must be sideways stone slabs or hanging trapdoors
chat.lotr.cwp.structure.invalid.base: Waypoint structure is missing a solid stone base (5x5)
chat.lotr.cwp.structure.invalid.notEmpty: Waypoint structure's bounding box is not empty of solids, liquids, and fire (%d)
chat.lotr.cwp.structure.frame: Waypoint structure needs an item frame
chat.lotr.cwp.structure.map.required: Waypoint structure's item frame needs an explored map
chat.lotr.cwp.structure.map.wrongArea: Waypoint structure's map does not cover the location of the waypoint
chat.lotr.cwp.structure.map.tooSmall: Waypoint structure's map is too small
chat.lotr.cwp.structure.map.notExplored: Waypoint structure's map is not sufficiently explored
chat.lotr.cwp.structure.tooClose.spawn: Waypoint structure is too close to the world's spawn point
chat.lotr.cwp.structure.tooClose.mapWayp: Waypoint structure is too close to a map waypoint (%s)
chat.lotr.cwp.structure.tooClose.otherCu: Waypoint structure is too close to another custom waypoint
chat.lotr.cwp.missing: The waypoint structure marker at '%s' no longer exists!
chat.lotr.cwp.protected: This area is protected by a custom waypoint!
chat.lotr.cwp.update.otherPlayer: This custom waypoint belongs to another player
chat.lotr.cwp.adopted.destroyed: Adopted custom waypoint '%s' was destroyed by its owner!

commands.lotr.lotr_date.display.multiple: Displaying the current date to %d players
